page.title: 15THE PUMP HOUSE
page.content:
The Pump House is situated in Sywell Park and was completed in 1906 It was built near site of the old mill which had been in existence about 600 years. The pumps were the final process of the reservoir. Water came through the valve tower into the outlet basin, and from there into 3 filter beds. It then went into clear water tanks and suction wells.
The water was then pumped into 11 inch delivery mains which fed the water towers in MEARS ASHBY, SYWELL, ECTON and EARLS BARTON. Most of the water was pumped to RUSHDEN and took three and a half hours to travel 9 miles.
